title: Radio National AM Extra: Aust companies not prepared to deal with changing economic fortunes
contributor: Peter Ryan (Reporter); A new report out today is showing an alarming number of Australian companies are not prepared to deal with changing economic fortunes. In a financial health check of more than 200 listed companies, 20 percent were found to be on the sick list with a further 11 percent showing some troubling signs. The report's author, Martyn Strickland of the corporate advisory group 333 Performance Management, warns companies who have grown complacent during the good times could be in for a hard landing - especially if the United States goes into a recession.Martyn Strickland has been speaking with our Business Editor Peter Ryan.
